result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on April 20, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

1:58 PM Prosecuting attorney Angelina R Scarpelli appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Johnny J. Lavora appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Dominique McQueen appeared by video for Johnny J. Lavora. 
Attorney McQueen was just appointed and is requesting an adjournment.  Defendant waives the statutory time period within which a preliminary hearing must be held.  Court tolls time limits. 
Preliminary  hearing reset to 04-20-2022 at 3:00pm.

Defendant in custody.   
Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.   Preliminary hearing is set for 04-13-22 at 1:30 p.m.   
Minutes.
Re:  Felony bail jumping, repeater, on 03-28-22.
Order to report to MCSD for photo and prints
Commitment for Failure to Furnish Bail.

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crime of possess methamphetamine with intent to deliver, possess schedule I or II narcotic with intent to deliver, possess marijuana with intent to deliver, possess drug paraphernalia and felony bail jumping.  The matter is continued for initial appearance on 04-04-22 at 1:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $5,000.00 cash bond with the conditions that he report to the Manitowoc County Sheriff's Department for fingerprints, photographs and identifying information within 48 hours or, if incarcerated, within 72 hours of release and defendant must maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol and drugs.  Bail not furnished and defendant is remanded to the custody of the Sheriff.  
Minutes.
